description: From Middle English spere-hed; equivalent to spear +â€Ž head.

entries.meaning: The pointed head, or end, of a spear.
One who leads or initiates an activity (such as an attack or a campaign).
The leading military unit in an attack.
(sports) A player who initiates attacking moves.

verbs.description: spearhead (third-person singular simple present spearheads, present participle spearheading, simple past and past participle spearheaded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To drive or campaign ardently for, as an effort, project, etc.
examples: He spearheaded the entire project from day one.
